ARABIC: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ فِىٓ أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We created man in the finest mould.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That We created man of finest possibilities,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: surely We created man in the best mould;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We have created the human being in the best form
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We have indeed created man in the best shape.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We created man in the best form.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Certainly We created man in the best make.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We indeed created Man in the fairest stature
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Surely We created man of the best stature
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have indeed created man in the best of mould,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Assuredly We have created man in goodliest mould,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We certainly created man in the best of forms;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: We have indeed created man in the best of moulds,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We created man of the best stature (mould),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, We created the human with the fairest stature
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We created man in the best design.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: We have certainly created man in the best of stature;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [95:4] Verily We created man (al-insān: the generic) in the best of forms, [in the best] proportioning of his shape.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Surely We created man) the disbelieving man, referring here to al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah, and it is also said it refers to Kildah Ibn Usayd (of the best stature) in the best of forms; and this is the reason why the oath was made.
